meanings.definition: To make a solemn promise or commitment.
meanings.sent1: She was vowing to always be there for her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The couple stood before their loved ones, vowing to love each other forever.
meanings.sent3: The cat was vowing to catch the elusive red dot once and for all.
meanings.sent4: The hero raised his sword, vowing to defeat the evil dragon and save the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The student looked up at the stars, vowing to study hard and reach for the sky.

meanings.sent1: His vowing to always keep his word earned him respect from all.
meanings.sent2: The vowing of allegiance to the flag was a tradition at the school.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's vowing to protect its favorite toy was both adorable and determined.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood tall, its rings vowing the passage of many years.
meanings.sent5: The family heirloom held sentimental value, its vowing passed down through generations.
